desc: This course focuses on important issues, images, authors and modes in an intensive study of racial and multicultural literature in the U.S. The scope of the course can include racial portraiture, sexual politics, field and factory experience, color and class status, and church and family institutions. Authors include such writers as Frederick Douglass and Maxine Hong Kingston.
name: Top: Asian- Am Psychol
title: Topics in American Racial and Multicultural Literatures
